On Wed, 2005-05-11 at 12:35 +1000, Dennis Hotson wrote:
> I've been looking at heritrix for about a week now and it's working
> really well. I've got it crawling and inserting pages into a database.
> 
> I'm just wondering what kind of scheduling functionality is available in
> heritrix.
> For example.. is there a way to schedule a job to run at 2:00 AM every 3
> days? 


Ok.. I've been doing some more investigation and I'm thinking of using
another java scheduler (http://www.opensymphony.com/quartz/) and I was
thinking of setting up jobs in heritrix via the JMX interface.
The only problem is that the JMX interface appears to be quite primitive
in comparison to the web interface. :P
Are there plans to improve the functionality of the JMX interface? If
not.. How hard would it be to do it myself?

Otherwise.. are there any other ways I can automate configuring/running
jobs in heritrix?
The web interface is very nice, but I need to be able to automate the
process so that a real user isn't required.

Any ideas? :)


Regards,
Dennis
